Posts.Content: CKCSLover wrote: So, like many of you (but not enough of you), with biopsies for BIRAD 4 clustered pleomorphic (or other) microcalcs, I called my BS office this afternoon (when she hadn't called me, natch) and was told benign - no atypical hyperplasia.  I still have to see her Friday to find out what if anything she thinks I should do about the other lump that didn't show in mammogram or ultrasound, but at least I can stop clutching my Xanax bottle and obsessing, ruminating, and otherwise being a total basket case.  I think what made it worse was how long it all took - from mammogram to today's call, 6 weeks, 2 days.    I think I feel angry, mad (at having to go through all this), sorry for myself, and of course grateful that there is so much support here and sympathy for wimps & whiners like me!! SO - those of you worried and waiting, I'm feeling a bit more trustful about the 80% vs. 20% benign stats.  And learned a ton along the way, mostly that this is the most amazing and supportive group of people I've ever seen.  I will definitely be back if/when I have other questions or something else comes up (hopefully not) and will check in from time to time, just because ... Diane Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: B-9 Results! CKCSLover hollyann

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 08:33PM CKCSLover wrote: Joni wrote: "I've never seen a blood pressure cuff in my surgeon's office. I know why....cause they'd say we're all about to have a heart attack!!!" Well - when I went for my first consult with the surgeon, the nurse DID take my blood pressure - when the reading came out high (naturally), she said, "oh, it's a little high - are you nervous?"  duh-HUH??   She didn't seem like a newbie, either.  She also told me when she scheduled my biopsy that she was also giving me a follow-up appt. for results 8 days following the biopsy - when I asked "doesn't she call?" the nurse said no, but if I wanted that, I would have to tell her at the biopsy.  You bet I will -!!  I cannot believe any doctor would wait on reports, much less a breast surgeon - I wonder how many of them actually have gone through the agony.... Diane
Posts.Title: If cancer, do they call me??? jjjmjoh I_am_4_GOD

Posts.Content: CKCSLover wrote: I never thought this day would get here - my husband is picking me up in about 10 minutes.  I just spoke with a co-worker who had the exact same thing a few months ago, and she reassured me that it's really not bad at all, and of course her's turned out B9.  I have my Xanax ready to take (about 1/2 hour before the procedure) and then I guess the really hard waiting begins, huh? So I'm as ready as I'll ever be.  Hopefully I can talk the BS into calling me before the followup appt. Thanks for all your help.  These boards are keeping me sane! Diane Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy @ 3:30 today CKCSLover CKCSLover

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2009 09:12AM CKCSLover wrote: So - had it and they got good samples (she said); it did hurt a bit but she loaded me up with novocaine or whatever.  I feel kinda crappy though - I mean, I took the day off from work - and can only take Tylenol, but it's pinching somewhat.  She said I can't shower for 2 days at least and have to keep my sports bra on 24 hours a day for 2 days.   I was going to go to Boston by train today or tomorrow to visit my sister who's in on a work trip from Paris, but they said they wouldn't recommend it, and frankly, I don't feel like it - esp. since I can't shower!!   I think I feel more emotionally drained than anything.  The BS promised (after I made her!) that she would call me when the results were in, which she didn't think would be before Wed. at the earliest.  Thanks for the support - !!  Guess I'll go over to the "Waiting for results" board ... whoopee!! Diane
Posts.Title: Biopsy @ 3:30 today CKCSLover CKCSLover
